latest news.summary: Mortgage rates continued to fall on Friday, with the average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage rate dropping to 6.16%, its lowest level since early April 2023. This marks a four-day plunge of 17 points, reducing the average by 90 basis points from July's high of 7.08%. The 15-year mortgage rate also fell, to a new average of 5.19%, its lowest level since February 2023. The decline in rates is attributed to the Federal Reserve's decision to maintain the federal funds rate at its current level since July 2023, and its signal to start cutting rates due to cooling inflation. According to Freddie Mac, the weekly average of 30-year mortgage rates was flat last week, after dropping to 6.35%—the lowest weekly average since May 2023. It's essential to shop around for the best mortgage rate and compare rates regularly, as rates vary widely across lenders.
latest news.title: Mortgage Rates Continue Falling - Sept. 9, 2024

latest news.eng_title: 30-Year Fixed Rate Below 6.4% Prior to Inflation Data Release. Today's Mortgage Rates, Sept. 9, 2024
latest news.summary: The average interest rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage is 6.37% today, down -0.05% from last week. The Federal Reserve is expected to make its first interest rate cut in September, which should help mortgage rates fall in the coming months. Experts predict a gradual decline in mortgage rates over the long term, but a return to the 2-3% rates from a few years ago is unlikely. According to Greg Sher, managing director at NFM Lending, 'As history shows, once the cutting begins, it triggers a series of rate cuts over a long period of time.' The Fed could lower rates at its September meeting and potentially cut an additional one or two times this year. 'That first cut will allow those tied to housing or interested in buying to exhale,' said Sher. Homebuyers can take advantage of lower mortgage rates by comparing multiple offers and getting a custom quote from a lender.
latest news.title: 30-Year Fixed Rate Below 6.4% Prior to Inflation Data Release. Today's Mortgage Rates, Sept. 9, 2024

latest news.summary: Mortgage rates have decreased across all loan terms, according to Bankrate data. The average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage is 6.37 percent, down 5 basis points since last week. This is a decline of $3.28 from last week's payments. The average rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage is 5.71 percent, down 13 basis points since last week. The average rate for a 5/1 ARM is 5.94 percent, falling 10 basis points over the last 7 days. The average rate for a jumbo mortgage is 6.51 percent, down 6 basis points from a week ago. According to Greg McBride, CFA, chief financial analyst for Bankrate, 'the expectation is that the Federal Reserve will be cutting interest rates multiple times over the next year or two, so a consistent downtrend in mortgage rates well into next year is a reasonable assumption.'
latest news.title: Current mortgage rates, September 9, 2024

latest news.eng_title: Mortgage and refinance rates today, September 9, 2024: Rates down 98 basis points this quarter
latest news.summary: Mortgage rates have decreased significantly this quarter, with the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate down 98 basis points since July 1 to 5.77%. The average 15-year fixed rate is down by 1.04% to 5.07%. According to Zillow data, these lower rates could make it a good time to buy a house, especially for those who are financially ready. However, mortgage refinance rates tend to be a little higher than purchase rates. A mortgage calculator can help individuals see how different mortgage term lengths and interest rates will impact their monthly payments. The article also discusses the pros and cons of different types of mortgages, including 15-year versus 30-year mortgages and adjustable-rate mortgages. Additionally, it provides tips on how to get the lowest mortgage rates, such as saving more, improving credit scores, and paying down debt. Overall, the article suggests that mortgage rates are likely to decrease in 2024 and 2025, making it a good time to consider purchasing a home.
latest news.title: Mortgage and refinance rates today, September 9, 2024: Rates down 98 basis points this quarter

latest news.eng_title: Small Improvements in Mortgage Rates: Today's Mortgage Rates for Sept. 9, 2024
latest news.summary: The average interest rate for a standard 30-year fixed mortgage is 6.37% today, down -0.05% compared to one week ago. The Federal Reserve is expected to make its first interest rate cut in September, which should help mortgage rates fall in the coming months. Experts predict a gradual decline in mortgage rates over the long term, but a return to the 2-3% mortgage rates from just a few years ago is unlikely. According to Greg Sher, managing director at NFM Lending, 'As history shows, once the cutting begins, it triggers a series of rate cuts over a long period of time.' The average rate for a 15-year fixed mortgage is 5.71%, and a 5/1 adjustable-rate mortgage has an average rate of 5.94% today. Homebuyers can take advantage of lower mortgage rates by comparing multiple offers and shopping around for lenders.

latest news.summary: The current mortgage interest rates in the US are highlighted by the average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage decreasing from 6.87% to 6.74% week over week. The 15-year fixed rate has also decreased by 19 basis points, while the 30-year fixed jumbo rate has decreased by 5 basis points. Experts predict that mortgage rates will remain at similar levels through 2024, with the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate hovering around 7% well into 2024. To get the best mortgage interest rate, it's recommended to shop around, check credit reports, monitor credit scores, save a 20% down payment, and pay down other consumer debt. Additionally, considering a 30-year fixed mortgage over a 15-year fixed mortgage may be beneficial for those seeking lower monthly payments, but the cost of a longer term is the significant interest paid over the longer period.
latest news.title: Today's mortgage interest rates: September 9, 2024

latest news.summary: The average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the United States remained at 6.35% this week, according to Freddie Mac. This is the same rate as last week and is the lowest it has been since May 11, 2023. The rate has fallen from 7.12% a year ago. Meanwhile, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage fell to 5.47% from 5.51% last week. The Federal Reserve is expected to cut its benchmark interest rate later this month, which could lead to further decreases in mortgage rates. However, elevated mortgage rates have kept many would-be homebuyers on the sidelines, extending the nation's housing slump into its third year. The National Association of Realtor's pending home sales index fell 5.5% in July from the previous month, suggesting a possible pullback in sales of previously occupied U.S. homes for August or September.
latest news.title: 30-year rate stays at 6.35%

latest news.eng_title: Mortgage Rates Hold Steady at Lowest Point in Over a Year
latest news.summary: The Freddie Mac rate for a 30-year mortgage remained at 6.35% this week, the lowest point in over a year. This is due to a cooling bond market, with the yield on 10-year Treasuries slipping below 3.9%. The Federal Reserve is expected to lower interest rates in response to the recent slowdown in inflation and uptick in unemployment, which will ease mortgage rates. This is welcome news for prospective homebuyers, who have faced challenges such as high listing prices and low inventory levels. As mortgage rates fall, more homes will come onto the market, and buyers will be able to afford more expensive homes on the same monthly budget. Realtor.com notes that recent data is already pointing to increased inventory and pace of new listings, trends that should continue as mortgage rates fall.
latest news.title: Mortgage Rates Hold Steady at Lowest Point in Over a Year

news knowledge.eng_title: Mortgage Rates Inch Up from 16-Month Low – Aug. 28, 2024
news knowledge.summary: Mortgage rates have inched up from a 16-month low, with 30-year fixed rates rising to 6.33%. This is just above the 6.28% reading seen on Monday and August 5, which was the cheapest average since April 2023. Rates have dropped significantly from their July high of 7.08% and the historic 23-year high of 8.01% reached last October. The rates are influenced by a complex interaction of macroeconomic and industry factors, including the Federal Reserve's bond-buying policy and the federal funds rate. The Fed has maintained the federal funds rate at its current level since last July, and is hesitant to start cutting rates until inflation falls sufficiently and sustainably. According to Freddie Mac, the weekly average of 30-year mortgage rates dipped to 6.46% last week, after plunging to its lowest weekly average since May 2023. It's essential to shop around for the best mortgage option and compare rates regularly, as rates vary widely across lenders.
news knowledge.title: Mortgage Rates Inch Up from 16-Month Low – Aug. 28, 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 U.S. mortgage seesaw back down, says Freddie Mac
news knowledge.summary: Freddie Mac reports that the 30-year fixed mortgage rate averaged 6.46% for the week ending Aug. 22, down from 6.49% last week. According to Sam Khater, Freddie Mac's chief economist, 'Although mortgage rates have stayed relatively flat over the past couple of weeks, softer incoming economic data suggest rates will gently slope downward through the end of the year.' Khater believes that rates will need to decline another percentage point to generate buyer demand. Meanwhile, Dayton-area home sales have been climbing, with local home and condo transactions increasing every month this year, including in July.
news knowledge.title: 2024 U.S. mortgage seesaw back down, says Freddie Mac

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates up slightly after substantive dip, says Freddie Mac
news knowledge.summary: According to Freddie Mac, the 30-year fixed mortgage rate averaged 6.49% for the week ending Aug. 15, up from 6.47% last week. Despite the slight increase, mortgage rates remain more than half a percent lower than the same time last year. Sam Khater, Freddie Mac's chief economist, said, 'While rates increased slightly this week, they remain more than half a percent lower than the same time last year.' He also noted that lower rates are good news for potential buyers and sellers alike, and that rates are likely to trend down in the coming months as inflation continues to slow. In related news, Dayton-area home sales have been climbing recently, with local home and condo transactions increasing every month this year, including in May.
news knowledge.title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates up slightly after substantive dip, says Freddie Mac

news knowledge.eng_title: Average 30-year Mortgage Rate Hovers Around Lowest Level Since May 2023: Freddie Mac
news knowledge.summary: The average 30-year fixed mortgage rate has remained steady at around 6.5 percent, its lowest level in over a year, according to Freddie Mac data. Sam Khater, chief economist at Freddie Mac, stated, 'While rates increased slightly this week, they remain more than half a percent lower than the same time last year.' The 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has been declining since peaking at 7.79 percent in October 2023. Meanwhile, the 15-year fixed-rate mortgage edged up to 5.66 percent, but is still down from 6.46 percent last year. Refinancing demand has increased by 117 percent compared to the same time last year, and overall mortgage applications have risen by nearly 17 percent, the highest level since January 2023. However, industry experts believe that the housing market will not experience a sharp downturn due to the lack of supply and elevated demand, but market conditions may come into better balance.
news knowledge.title: Average 30-year Mortgage Rate Hovers Around Lowest Level Since May 2023: Freddie Mac

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates take substantive dip, says Freddie Mac
news knowledge.summary: According to Freddie Mac, the 30-year fixed mortgage rate averaged 6.47% for the week ending Aug. 8, down from 6.73% last week. This is the lowest level in over a year, said Sam Khater, Freddie Mac's chief economist. 'Mortgage rates plunged this week to their lowest level in over a year following the likely over-reaction to a less than favorable employment report and financial market turbulence for an economy that remains on solid footing,' Khater said. The decline in mortgage rates increases prospective homebuyers' purchasing power and is already providing existing homeowners the opportunity to refinance, with the refinance share of market mortgage applications reaching nearly 42 percent, the highest since March 2022. This comes as Dayton-area home sales have been climbing, with local home and condo transactions increasing every month this year, including in May.
news knowledge.title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates take substantive dip, says Freddie Mac

news knowledge.eng_title: US Mortgage Rates Hit Lowest Level in Over a Year
news knowledge.summary: The 30-year fixed mortgage rate in the US has reached a low of 6.47% this week, according to Freddie Mac. This is the lowest level in over a year, following a probable overreaction to a less-than-favorable employment report and market financial turmoil. 'The drop in mortgage rates increases the purchasing power of potential homebuyers and should start to pique their interest in making a move,' said Sam Khater, Freddie Mac's chief economist. 'Additionally, this drop in rates is already giving some existing homeowners the opportunity to refinance, with the refinance share of mortgage applications reaching nearly 42%, the highest since March 2022.' The 30-year fixed mortgage rate was 6.47% on average as of August 8, 2024, down from 6.73% the previous week, and 6.96% a year ago. The 15-year fixed mortgage rate was 5.63% on average, down from 5.99% the previous week, and 6.34% a year ago.
news knowledge.title: USA, Freddie Mac: tassi sui mutui a 30 anni ai minimi in oltre un anno

news knowledge.eng_title: Mortgage Interest Rates Today, August 6, 2024 | Rates Plunge. Is It Finally a Good Time to Buy a House?
news knowledge.summary: Mortgage interest rates have plummeted to their lowest level in over a year, with average 30-year mortgage rates currently around 6%, according to Zillow data. This decline is attributed to weaker-than-expected labor market data and concerns of a possible economic downturn. While rates are expected to continue trending down over the next couple of years, experts warn that demand will surge and home prices will rise further. However, buying a house now will allow you to benefit from today's lower rates and any future increases in your home's value. Additionally, you can refinance into a lower monthly payment later on if rates drop further. The average 30-year fixed mortgage rate was 6.73% last week, a five-basis-point decrease from the previous week, according to Freddie Mac. A 15-year fixed-rate mortgage might be a good option for those looking for predictability and lower interest payments, but with a higher monthly payment. As inflation comes down, mortgage rates will recede, and most major forecasts expect rates to go down throughout the rest of 2024.
news knowledge.title: Mortgage Interest Rates Today, August 6, 2024 | Rates Plunge. Is It Finally a Good Time to Buy a House?

news knowledge.eng_title: US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage edges up to 6.78%, Freddie Mac says
news knowledge.summary: The average rate on the US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage increased to 6.78% for the week ending July 25, according to Freddie Mac. Despite the lower rates, buyers are still hesitant to enter the market, with existing home sales falling 5.4% in June to the slowest rate since December. Housing inventory, however, has jumped to the highest in nearly four years, leading to a slow shift from a seller's market to a buyer's market. Homeowners are holding on to properties with lower rates, and rising home insurance premiums are hurting affordability. Economists expect borrowing costs to ease further later this year as the Federal Reserve shifts to interest rate cuts.
news knowledge.title: US 30-year fixed-rate mortgage edges up to 6.78%, Freddie Mac says

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates drop for consecutive weeks, says Freddie Mac
news knowledge.summary: According to Freddie Mac, the 30-year fixed mortgage rate averaged 6.77% for the week ending July 18, a decrease from 6.89% last week. This marks the second consecutive week of declining mortgage rates. Freddie Mac's chief economist, Sam Khater, stated that the 30-year fixed-rate mortgage fell to its lowest level since mid-March, dropping 12 basis points from last week. Khater noted that while mortgage rates are headed in the right direction, homebuyers have yet to respond to lower rates, with purchase application demand still roughly 5% below spring levels. Despite this, Dayton-area home sales have been climbing recently, with local home and condo transactions increasing every month this year.
news knowledge.title: 2024 U.S. mortgage rates drop for consecutive weeks, says Freddie Mac

news knowledge.eng_title: Key U.S. mortgage rate drops to lowest since March, Freddie Mac says
news knowledge.summary: The average interest rate on the 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the US has fallen to its lowest level since mid-March, according to Freddie Mac. The rate averaged 6.77% for the week ending July 18, down from 6.89% the previous week. Despite the decline, homebuyers are not yet responding to the lower rates, with purchase application demand remaining 5% below its spring levels. Freddie Mac's chief economist, Sam Khater, attributed this to buyers waiting for rates to decline further before making a purchase. The housing market has been affected by the Federal Reserve's interest rate increases since 2022, with existing-home sales reaching a 29-year low in 2023. Economists are hopeful that the anticipated start of rate cuts by the Fed could support the housing market through lowered borrowing costs in the months ahead.
news knowledge.title: Key U.S. mortgage rate drops to lowest since March, Freddie Mac says
